flawed_nl_solution:
This past Saturday, Jessy and Alan told a total of 11+7 = <<11+7=18>>18 jokes together.
Since Jessy told eleven jokes this past Saturday, when he doubles the number of jokes next Saturday, the number of jokes will be 2*11= 22 next Saturday.
At the same time, after telling seven jokes this Saturday, when he doubles the number of jokes next Saturday, Alan will tell 2*7 = <<2*7=41>>41 jokes.
Next Saturday, they will tell 41+22 = <<41+22=63>>63 jokes together.
In total, the number of jokes will be 63+18 = <<63+18=81>>81 jokes on the two Saturdays.
#### 81

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 14, not 41. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
